channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Scott C. Beardsley Named University of Virginia’s New President
item.description: The selection of Scott Beardsley by the G.O.P.-appointed board comes after the previous president resigned under pressure from the Trump administratio...

item.title: Exclusive: Cursor acquires code review startup Graphite as AI coding competition heats up
item.description: The deal gives Cursor, currently valued at $29 billion, more code review and debugging capabilities.

item.title: Sam Altman says he’s ‘0%’ excited to be CEO of a public company as OpenAI drops hints about an IPO: ‘In some ways I think it’d be really annoying’
item.description: Reports of OpenAI’s plans to go public coincide with Altman declaring a “code red” for the company, something he said he plans to do multiple times in...

item.title: AI whiz Yann LeCun is already targeting a $3.5 billion valuation for his new startup—and it hasn’t even launched yet
item.description: The legendary AI researcher announced his departure from Meta, Mark Zuckerberg’s social media empire, just one month ago.

item.title: Bumpy Rollout for New Gates Meant to Stop Subway Fare Evasion
item.description: At a demonstration of devices designed to replace turnstiles, one rider got hit in the neck, and another sneaked through without paying.

item.title: Steve Jobs sold his Volkswagen to raise $1,300 for Apple’s first computer. He became a millionaire just two years later at 23
item.description: Steve Jobs sold his car to raise enough money to build Apple’s first computer. Just one year later, the tech titan reeled in nearly $3 million thanks ...

item.title: Roblox CEO David Baszucki says the best career advice he’s ever received is to outright ignore the advice of others

item.title: To Secure Money for Ukraine, Europe Had to Resort to a Messy Compromise
item.description: The European Union came up with an 11th-hour deal to help Ukraine, but the solution raised questions about the bloc’s decisiveness.
